channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hermès leapfrogs LVMH to become Europe’s most valuable luxury company after the Louis Vuitton owner reported downbeat results
item.description: “Some people want to do a bit like Hermès, but it doesn’t work out at the end of the day,” Hermès executive chair Axel Dumas said in February.

item.title: Global stock markets make solid gains as U.S. dollar shows weakness
item.description: The U.S. bond market is struggling with a departure from the dollar.

item.title: The White House pressed for fast negotiations with its shock and awe tariffs. Now it can’t drum up enough interest from a ‘first mover’
item.description: The rhetoric out of Trump's cabinet on tariffs is changing, with Scott Bessent pushing for a "first mover" to sign on the dotted line for a deal with ...

item.title: Melinda French Gates explains why her new book focuses on big transitions, and why Warren Buffett was one of the first to learn about her divorce
item.description: In 'The Next Day,' Melinda French Gates explores big transitions, including her divorce, her departure from the Gates Foundation, and turning 60.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg suggested wiping everyone’s Facebook friends and making users start again to boost the platform’s relevance
item.description: The email was revealed as part of the FTC's landmark antitrust case against Meta.

item.title: Boeing stock falls in premarket trade on report China to block deliveries
LVMH now in battle with Hermes for world's top luxury firm after sales miss
Another Wall Street firm has lowered its S&P 500 target, citing stagflation risk
